name: Xenophobe
description:
Xenos. The very name strikes fear into every colonist's heart. A distress call is received from space stations orbiting your homeworld, then silence. A single ship escapes, piloted by a battered man who tells the tale of pods that hatch into acid-spitting Xenos. A small band of engineers has been dispatched to combat the Xeno threat before it takes over all the space stations and, eventually, your homeworld.

Xenophobe is a side-scrolling shooter with platform elements. Assemble your band of engineers and fight the Xenos on each station, striving to either clear it or abandon it. You start out with a standard issue laser, but can pick up additional weapons as you find them, including Phasers, Lightning Rifles, Poofer guns, and bombs.
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Arcade, Atari 2600, Atari 7800, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Lynx, NES | Combined View

shot.caption: This is the screen the game displays as it loads
The display screen is closely followed by a copyright screen which gives way to ....
... the game's main menu. The description of the currently selected option revolves and becomes very hard to read.
Before the game can start the player must select the character they will play as. This lot is screen / team two
The selected character is transferred from the big friendly blue ship to the little white ship in the small flying saucer like thing
Our character has landed. Those things on the ground are bad aliens in dormant state
They've woken up. One is crawling off to the left. The other one has found the exterminator
This is some kind of energy leech. It has attached itself to the exterminator and is draining health, the health counter on the left has started to decrease.
Luckily - when another alien rolls up and knocks her down the energy leech is dislodged. All this before she gets off a shot!
While on the ground she can still shoot. That's a tentacle that's going splat. Also the energy leeches ignore her when she's on the ground
The action keys are non standard. I managed to get her sitting up but could not get her to stand, so she explored the station while sitting down
As the station is explored items can be picked up, here its a key
68% infestation. It was 69% when she entered this room but now there's a few less aliens. Sitting up though allows another energy leech to attach itself
The next room. She's lost her gun but luckily there's one or two lying around. There's just over 2 minutes to complete the mission.
Less that 2 minutes, she's standing and that causes the 'push button' message to appear. It was not there while she was seated
This does not look like a healthy area
There are some really big nasty things around.
This room was reasonably safe last time she was in here. Where'd that tentacle come from!
